title.rendered: Namibia vs Canada, World Cup Qualifiers 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team on basis of probable XIs, recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Namibia: Shaun Fouche, Nikolaas Davin, Michael van Lingen, Gerhard Erasmus (c), Jan Nicol Loftie-Eaton, Zane Green (wk), Karl Birkenstock, Pikky Ya France, Ruben Trumpelmann, Bernard Scholtz, Ben Shikongo

Canada: Aaron Johnson, Pargat Singh, Matthew Spoors, Srimantha Wijeratne (wk), Nicholas Kirton, Harsh Thaker, Nikhil Dutta, Saad Bin Zafar (c), Ravinderpal Singh, Kaleem Sana, Jeremy Gordon

Pitch Report

Venue: Wanderers Cricket Ground, Windhoek

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 234

2nd innings average score: 238

Wickets per innings: 7

Type: Good for spin

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Also Read:

Delhi vs Gujarat Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Nikhil Dutta is one of the most productive picks in fantasy leagues for his all-round abilities. In his last 10 List A outings, he has scalped 17 wickets and collected 201 runs at 34, producing at least 77 points per game.

Michael van Lingen (279 runs at 47) and Ruben Trumpelmann (21 wickets at 16) are the top run-getter and wicket-taker respectively at the venue.

Pargat Singh’s only hundred of his professional career came at the very venue, thanks to his ability to dominate spin. His 102 runs included bonus points for 15 boundaries.

Srimantha Wijeratne scored three fifties in his last five List A appearances. In one of the two games he did not score a fifty, he gave points for three catches with the gloves.

Gerhard Erasmus (283 runs and 6 wickets) and Bernard Scholtz (6 wickets) made it to the Best11 in three of the last five games.

Saad Bin Zafar has been the best fantasy player from Canada in the series, giving bonus points for three-for twice in three attempts. In fact, he has exceptional List A numbers: 60 wickets at a strike rate of 28.

Zane Green has generated an average of 16 points per match only with the gloves at Wanderers Cricket Ground. With the bat, he averages 26.

In the last three matches, spinners accounted for 40% of the wickets.
